titleStmt.title: The nuptialls of Peleus and Thetis. Consisting of a mask and a comedy, or The the [sic] great royall ball, acted lately in Paris six times by the King in person. The Duke of Anjou. The Duke of Yorke. with divers other noble men. Also by the Princess Royall Henrette Marie. The Princess of Conty. The Dutchess of Roquelaure. The Dutchess of Crequy. with many other ladies of honour.
titleStmt.author: Howell, James, 1594?-1666.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Herringman, and are to be sold at his shop at the Ancor in the lower walke of the New Exchange.,

notesStmt.note: The comedy has a separate dated title page, pagination and register.
Possibly translated from the Tedide of Diamante Gabrielli. Cf. BM, v. 107, col. 922.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop at the Ancor in the lower walke of the New Exchange.
